listing.description: The HeathThe Heath is a two bedroom duplex penthouse on top of the Maple Building.Total AreaInterior: 118.28 sq m; 1,273 sq ftTerrace: 81.61 sq m; 878 sq ft5th FloorLiving / Kitchen: 7.11 sq m x 5.56 sq m; 23.32 sq ft x 18.23 sq ftMaster Bedroom: 7.39 sq m x 2.67 sq m; 24.24 sq ft x 8.77 sq ftBedroom 2: 4.34 sq m x 3.48 sq m; 14.23 sq ft x 11.43 sq ftTerrace: 20.78 sq m x 9.13 sq m; 68.16 sq ft x 29.95 sq ft6th FloorLiving / Study: 7.66 sq m x 3.20 sq m; 25.14 sq ft x 10.51 sq ftTerrace: 8.46 sq m x 5.76 sq m; 27.77 sq ft x 18.90 sq ftThe Maple Building has 57 high specification apartments in a stunning converted warehouse in prime North West London.The fifty apartments and seven new build penthouses span five storeys of this converted warehouse building. London is a city of villages, and Kentish Town tells this story well. The area is a vivid mix of urban vibrancy and pastoral peace, located in poll position between cool Camden Town, airy Hampstead Heath and Regent's Park - and it has a growing sense of its own identity. There are soaring views from the Maple Building, a result of its elevated location on the way to Highgate and Hampstead - the two London hilltop villages that crown North London.The Maple BuildingThe Maple Building is robust and elegant, a clean-lined construction dating from the earliest twentieth century with red brick facades and steel columns. Once a furniture factory, then a clothing factory, it is characterised by the large metal double-glazed windows in the period Crittall style which feature throughout. With a high internal specification as well as its signature rhythmic fenestration, the Maple Building has insisted on strong acoustic and design performance, ensuring that all interior spaces are as cosy and comfortable as they are well lit and airy.LocationLondon is a city of villages, and Kentish Town tells this story well. The area is a vivid mix of urban vibrancy and pastoral peace, located in poll position between cool Camden Town, airy Hampstead Heath and Regent's Park - and it has a growing sense of its own identity. There are soaring views from the Maple Building, a result of its elevated location on the way to Highgate and Hampstead - the two London hilltop villages that crown North London.

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or ??420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee ??? From ??440 (Inc. VAT)???

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent ??? To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance ??? 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit ??? Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds ??125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - ??420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of ??54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - ??75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - ??90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - ??150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - ??30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

The last stop on the Jubilee line, a journey to Bond Street from Stanmore takes 31 minutes.As an area Stanmore boasts an abundance of greenery, charming commons and acres of Green Belt. It is one of North West London???s most desirable areas due to its boutique cafes, shopping facilities, and location to prominent state and private schools which include Haberdashers??? Aske???s, North London Collegiate, St. Margaret???s, and Stanmore College.

listing.description: Three double bedroom apartment offering over 1250 square feet of living space.This apartment forms the top two floors of this imposing Edwardian conversion, spread over a generous 1232 square feet. The present owners have extensively renovated the property with contemporary features and neutral decor.The property is around 6-7 minutes walk to both Westcombe Park and Maze Hill stations offering direct access into London Cannon Street in under 20 minutes. The location benefits from a great selection of local shops, pubs, Ofsted Outstanding primary schools, nurseries, as well as the recently completed Greenwich Centre with a leisure centre, library and health clinic, all within 10 minutes??? walk.The entrance hall leads from the ground floor to the first, with a modern kitchen/diner to the rear with direct access to an extensive shared garden. The reception room retains original fireplace features and is presented in a neutral decor. The master bedroom in the top floor comprises an en suite bathroom and built in wardrobes. The second and third large double bedrooms offer further generous living space, with the latter currently arranged as a study and playroom. All three bedrooms oversee the garden, a piece of green space in the midst of London.

listing.description: This exceptional Queen Anne Grade ll*-listed house faces Greenwich's Royal Park and offers superb living space with numerous bedrooms and a wealth of period features. One of a distinguished pair of previously linked houses noted in Pevsner's Buildings of England as "especially well detailed", the property is a historic gem with virtually all of its 18th century features intact including wood panelling to all principle rooms, original shutters and wood flooring, eight-panelled doors, high coved ceilings and some fine period fireplaces.While currently arranged as having five bedrooms and four living rooms, its versatile accommodation could provide and additional two bedrooms if required. There are contemporary ensuites bathrooms and an ensuite shower room in three of the bedrooms and a further family bathroom.The reception space is arranged with an impressive reception hall, further reception room to the rear with a small kitchen just off it (perfect for dinner parties) and a grand first floor drawing room. The lower ground floor contains two room, one of which would be a dining/family/cinema room while the other has been wired and plumbed to allow an incoming buyer to create a spacious kitchen/breakfast room to their exact specification with a good-size utility room and pantry just off it. The delightful rear garden extends to almost 120 feet and is mainly laid to lawn with pathways surrounded by shrubs and trees. The secret garden at the far end has a paved terrace and childrens' playhouse. Set well back from the road behind imposing cast iron railings, the house is approached via a flag-stone front garden with steps up to the original front door. The house is incredibly bright and airy throughout with wonderful views of Greenwich Park and the City from the upper floors and subject to the completion of the kitchen and dining room would make an incredible long term family home.SituationMaze Hill overground station is within a few minutes' walk and the DLR at Cutty Sark is a pleasant walk through the Park or past the Naval College.The historic town centre is also within walkingdistance with a wealth of shops, restaurants, theatre and cinema.4 Reception Rooms 6 to 7 Bedrooms Kitchen Dining Room Utility Room 4 Bathrooms Utility Room Garden Roof Terrace
listing.short_description: This exceptional 5 bedroom Queen Anne Grade II*-listed house on Maze Hill faces Greenwich's Royal Park and offers incredible living space and a stunning private garden almost 120' long. It contains numerous period features such as high ceilings, original panelling and large sash windows.

The current vendor has thoughtfully renovated the property with fine attention to detail, creating a bright and well balanced home, perfect for both living and entertaining. It now benefits from a practical layout which sees the two sizeable double bedrooms at the front and stylish open plan kitchen/reception to the rear. The flat enjoys neutral interiors throughout and now benefits from a contemporary fitted kitchen and luxury shower room. listing.short_description: A great opportunity to acquire a two bedroom terrace house offered for sale with no onward chain. The property comprises entrance hall, a large reception room which in turn provides access to a delightful rear garden with pedestrian access. To the front of the property there is a garage with off street parking. The first floor comprises two double bedrooms and a family bathroom suite. Further benefits include a secluded rear garden, ample storage throughout and further scope to convert this property into three bedrooms and convert the garage subject to permission. Templar Place is ideally located in the heart of Hampton providing easy access to local schools such as Lady Eleanor Holles, Hampton School for Boys and Buckingham Primary, as well as being close to the local shops, train station and local bus routes of the 111 and R70 travelling to Hounslow, Kingston and Richmond.

listing.description: Situated within the iconic former Victorian department store Francis & Sons, this two bedroom flat extends to 982 sqft. The building is currently the subject of a 'back to brickwork' restoration and has been converted into eleven elegant Victorian apartments.Finished to an extremely high spec, the apartments have been beautifully refurbished. Graceful Victorian features have been enhanced or replicated and include authentic wooden sash windows, stately architraves and coving while the characteristic high ceilings add to the feeling of light and space. The choice of appliances, accessories and fittings complement the Victorian charm and underpin core values of quality, security and efficiency - themes that run deep at Francis House.Nb please note that the pictures shown are A MIX of indicative and computer generated shots and the EPC rating is an estimate

listing.description: A Fabulous Ground Floor Warner Flat.This lovely two bedroom flat will be the envy of your friends with its bright and airy interior, and we are sure you will feel right at home in no time. It is easy to see why this is rapidly becoming one of Walthamstow???s most popular areas. With Lloyd Park literally on your doorstep, you can satisfy your artistic curiosity at the William Morris Gallery, take a spot of exercise on the tennis courts or bowling greens, and you???ll still have time to pop into The Bell for a quick drink and bite to eat before heading back to your lovely home. Why live anywhere else?Living Here...This lovely ground floor Warner maisonette is perched on the very edge of Lloyd Park, and we think it is the perfect home, whatever the weather throws at you. Imagine sitting in the front lounge in the middle of winter, toasting your feet in front of the log burner, whilst the weather howls outside. Or if it???s Summer, then how about relaxing in the rear garden, perhaps whilst entertaining friends and family with your bbq skills? In between front and back, there???s plenty more packed into this flat, with two double bedrooms, a fitted kitchen (with access to the garden) and the family bathroom. All in all, a great flat, whatever the time of year.In This Area - By Walthamstow DiaryWilliam Morris was a Walthamstow lad, he lived in the Water House on Forest Road. His childhood home is now the William Morris Gallery, the only gallery on the face of the planet dedicated to his life and work. Lloyd Park, in which the gallery stands, is named after another former resident of the Water House, Edward Lloyd, a publisher of penny dreadfuls. As well as having a medieval moat, playground and a cafe, the park is also home to some great local events, including the May Day dog show which shouldn???t be missed. The best dressed dog round is amazing, one year it had a Star Wars theme, staffie princess Leahs competed against at-at Great Danes, it was glorious.The park is surrounded by quiet streets of ex Warner properties, The Bell pub is around the corner from the gallery, and the cafes of Hoe Street are just a short trot away. Give Wynwood art district a go, this little cafe has a lot going on, including a running club and exhibitions. Tommys tuck in cafe, opposite the park, is a good spot for a hangover fixing breakfast. All this is only a fifteen minute walk from the station.Dimensions:EntranceVia front door leading into:Entrance HallwayDoors To All Rooms.Lounge (4.14m x 3.28m (13'7 x 10'9))Kitchen (2.64m x 2.39m (8'8 x 7'10))Access To Rear Garden.Bedroom One (3.71m x 3.43m (12'2 x 11'3))Bedroom Two (3.28m x 3.18m (10'9 x 10'5))Bathroom (2.64m x 2.59m (8'8 x 8'6))Rear Garden (Shared) (approx 15.24m (approx 50'))The information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of any offer or contract, nor may it be relied upon as representations or statements of fact. The park is surrounded by quiet streets of ex Warner properties, The Bell pub is around the corner from the gallery, and the cafes of Hoe Street are just a short trot away. Give Wynwood art district a go, this little cafe has a lot going on, including a running club and exhibitions. Tommys tuck in cafe, opposite the park, is a good spot for a hangover fixing breakfast. All this is only a fifteen minute walk from the station.

Situated just a stone's throw from the highly sought after Deansfield primary school, this three bedroomed elevated semi detached family home is offered to the market for the first time in some 30 years. Internally the accommodation comprises of a large main reception, dining room, modern fitted kitchen, with three well appointed bedrooms and a family bathroom to the first floor. To the rear the garden is landscaped and beautifully kept with a detached garage off- set and a driveway to the front for off road parking.

Enclosed Entrance Porch

An enclosed double glazed entrance porch, solid wooden door to entrance hall.

Entrance Hall

Stairs to first floor, double glazed window to side, laminate flooring, under stairs storage cupboard, radiator.

Laminate flooring, double glazed patio doors for access to the garden, double glazed windows either side, picture rail, coved ceiling, centre light point.

Fitted with a range of eye and base units, roll top work surface with tiled surround, four ring hob with stainless steel splash back and extractor fan over, built in oven, plumbing for washing machine, integrated fridge/freezer, two double glazed windows to side and one to the rear, single sink unit with stainless steel drainer and mixer taps, inset spotlights, double glazed door for access to garden.

listing.description: A light and spacious ground floor one bedroom flat with sole use of a pretty rear garden converted from a Victorian mid-terraced house in sought after area close to Stroud Green Road and Finsbury Park Station.The property has its own front garden and entrance, which leads into the spacious entrance hall. The large living room has bay sash window, high ceilings, bespoke blinds and a feature fireplace. Along the corridor, the modern fitted kitchen has a breakfast bar and door to the garden. There is also a neat and fully functional bathroom, and a walk-in storage cupboard. To the rear of the property, the large double bedroom has a bay sash window as well as French doors with bespoke shutters leading to the sole use of the private Moroccan style patio garden.Stroud Green Road is a vibrant and cosmopolitan hub with all the shopping amenities, including one Tesco Metro supermarket and two Sainsbury's supermarkets as well as artisinal bakeries, delis and coffee shops. listing.description: Good size 2 bedroom apartment on 26th floor of The Waterman. The property further benefits from 2 bathrooms, one of which is en-suite, private balcony with far reaching south views and spacious kitchen living area.The Waterman is one of a collection of buildings that makes up the Lower Riverside district which spans much of the Peninsula's eastern shore. Located close to Central Park, the neighbourhoodcombines peacefulness with urban pastimes. At its social heart is Aperture, a shared space for residents with a caf??, deli, cr??che and gym. The Jetty, site of pop-ups and performances, formspart of Lower Riverside's lively waterfront.The tall, slim double tower of The Waterman rises 31 floors above the surrounding blocks and landscaped gardens, a white beacon marking the Lower Riverside district. listing.short_description:
A superb two bedroom end terrace home in Ruislip Manor. Enjoying bright, light filled and well appointed rooms the property has everything needed for a great starter home with great potential to further enhance and extend (subject to the usual planning consents.)

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor on Victoria Road office turn left. Go straight over the first roundabout and remain on Victoria Road. At the next roundabout take continue straight over onto Victoria Road and take the first left into Bessingby Road.

Situation

Bessingby Road is a popular residential road that is a short stroll to Ruislip Manor shops, trendy eateries and station (Metropolitan/ Piccadilly line) with direct links to The City and Baker Street. Ruislip Gardens (Central line) station is also a short walk whilst for the motorist London and the Home Counties are easily accessed via the A40/M25. A number of highly regarded schools are within close proximity including Lady Bankes Primary, Ruislip High and Bishop Ramsey Secondary, along with a number of leisure facilities including Ruislip Golf Club, Highgrove and Virgin Active Health Club. Bessingby park and playing fields leading into Cavendish gardens are a few moments away from the property.

Description

A charming and beautifully appointed two bedroom terraced house set on Bessingby road in Ruislip Manor. This welcoming home is set for family living and would make the perfect starter home or a great investment buy. Once inside the home via the entrance porch there is immediately the spacious and open plan lounge/diner where the stairs are to the first floor and patio doors are at the rear offering access to the garden. The lounge benefits from the charm of the large bay window to the front and ample room for a dining table and chairs. The room enjoys a light filled open space in a crisp, neutral decor and wooden flooring designed to cleverly maximise the space of the room. At the rear of the property is the kitchen which enjoys views of the garden and is complete with tiled flooring. Upstairs are two bedrooms, a large, bright master bedroom with a bay window and a second double bedroom to the rear as well as a modern, fully tiled bathroom. For those wanting more space there is scope to possibly extend and further enhance to make the property even more superb and add great value.

Outside

At the front of the house is a garden area filled with a selection of plants and shrubbery. At the rear is a private and well maintained garden laid to lawn and with a patio area.

listing.short_description: This fantastic apartment boasts: Two large double bedrooms with en-suite shower room to the master bedroom, floor to ceiling windows through out, granite and marble family bathroom, fully equipped designer kitchen with marble work surface and splash backs, fully integrated Siemens appliances.
